instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging - "replace now"
threads.message:
I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that had a lot of liquid damage from something white that smells and looks like it might have been milk. I saw some spill damage by <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>.
I UC'd the board and used an SSD i had laying around since the original ssd had some damage to it and it won't boot from it. I was able to login and get to the system information page and it says the battery is not charging and needs to be replaced.

The part of the battery that goes into the battery connector has some of that milk in the crevices and I have tried scraping out as much as I can.

In resistance mode I measured pins 17/18 & 27/28.
Pins 17/18 - 3.4 ohms
Pins 27/28 - 20.1ohms

Everything around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> look fine visually and all the probe points are still gold.

Should I replace <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> since Pins 17/18 should be 2.2ohms?

Here is an image of the system information page.
[URL="https://www.dropbox.com/s/q0351csf72el1q9/IMG_2656.JPG?dl=0"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/q0351csf72..._2656.JPG?dl=0[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging - "replace now"
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging - "replace now"
threads.message:
Okay I just didn't want to order a battery when the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> could be the problem here.
Also, where do you get your batteries from if you don't mind sharing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging - "replace now"
threads.message: If you are just ordering just one get it from Ebay. Try and find an original one and not a replacement type. This one has an A1496 battery.
